desc:
The OPTIONS HTTP method requests permitted communication options for a given URL or server.
  This can be used to test the allowed HTTP methods for a request, or to determine whether a request would succeed when making a CORS preflighted request.
  A client can specify a URL with this method, or an asterisk (*) to refer to the entire server.
title: OPTIONS - HTTP | MDN

desc: The CONNECT HTTP method requests that a proxy establish a HTTP tunnel to a destination server, and if successful, blindly forward data in both directions until the tunnel is closed.
title: CONNECT - HTTP | MDN

desc:
The GET HTTP method requests a representation of the specified resource.
  Requests using GET should only be used to request data and shouldnt contain a body.
title: GET - HTTP | MDN

desc: The POST HTTP method sends data to the server. The type of the body of the request is indicated by the Content-Type header.
title: POST - HTTP | MDN
